# Bazel documentation for LLMs
> Bazel is a fast, hermetic build system. Use this file to choose the right documentation snapshot for your LLM session.

## Documentation sets
- [Abridged documentation](llms-medium.txt): High-signal narrative with short excerpts for every major section.
- [Compressed documentation](llms-small.txt): Strictly limited summaries for low-token contexts.
- [Complete documentation](llms-full.txt): Entire Markdown corpus mirrors all MDX sources.

## Section snapshots
- [About Bazel](llms-section-about-bazel.txt) — 12 pages. Bazel is an open-source build and test tool similar to Make, Maven, and Gradle. It uses a human-readable, high-level build language. Bazel supports projects in multiple languages and builds outputs…
- [Getting started](llms-section-getting-started.txt) — 17 pages. This page describes the various platforms supported by Bazel and links to the packages for more details.
- [User guide](llms-section-user-guide.txt) — 38 pages. As announced in the original blog post, Bazel 4.0 and higher versions provides support for two release tracks: rolling releases and long term support (LTS) releases. This page covers the latest…
- [Reference](llms-section-reference.txt) — 4 pages. ## Concepts and terminology
- [Extending](llms-section-extending.txt) — 13 pages. {/ [TOC] /}
- [Community](llms-section-community.txt) — 17 pages. There are many ways to help the Bazel project and ecosystem.

## Archived versions
- Bazel 8.4.2: https://bazel.build/8.4.2/ (snapshot only)
- Bazel 8.3.1: https://bazel.build/8.3.1/ (snapshot only)
- Bazel 8.2.1: https://bazel.build/8.2.1/ (snapshot only)
- Bazel 8.1.1: https://bazel.build/8.1.1/ (snapshot only)
- Bazel 8.0.1: https://bazel.build/8.0.1/ (snapshot only)
- Bazel 7.6.1: https://bazel.build/7.6.1/ (snapshot only)
- Bazel 6.5.0: https://bazel.build/6.5.0/ (snapshot only)

## Notes
- Canonical domain: https://bazel.build/
- Docs snapshot: HEAD
- Generated: 2025-11-12 17:06:48 UTC
- Source repo: https://github.com/bazel-contrib/bazel-docs
- Preview locally: run `mint dev` then open http://localhost:3000/llms.txt
